com.px100systems.util.serialization

Class SerializationDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.px100systems.util.serialization.SerializationDefinition

  • public class SerializationDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
    Definition to serialize class.
    Used in universal reflection-based Externalizable, Portable, and other implementations.
    Application (JVM) wide singleton. Not thread-safe during creation for performance reasons - expected to be created by one "initialization" thread. Register every class using register() and then call lock().
    Author:
    Alex Rogachevsky

      • write

        public void write(ExternalWriter writer,
                  java.lang.Object bean)
        External field-level writer serialization: used by Hazelcast's Portable implementation and Mongo serialization. Serializes all top level fields plus serialized getters. Collections and sub-objects are serialized as binary data (byte arrays).
        Parameters:
        writer - the field writer
        bean - the bean

      • read

        public void read(DataStream stream,
                 java.lang.Object bean)

        Parameters:

        bean - the bean

      • read

        public void read(ExternalReader reader,
                 java.lang.Object bean)
        External field-level reader deserialization: used by Hazelcast's Portable implementation and Mongo serialization. Serializes all top level fields plus serialized getters. Collections and sub-objects are serialized as binary data (byte arrays).
        Parameters:
        reader - the field reader
        bean - the bean
